solution.text: Hardy was a mathematician and Weinberg was a physician. They devised Hardy- Weinberg principle. According to this principle, the allelic frequencies will remain constant in a population if there is no evolution taking place. In other words, if no evolution takes place the sum of allele frequency will always be equal to one. This is Hardy -Weinberg Equilibrium. Five factors are known to affect Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium. These are gene migration or gene flow, genetic drift, mutation, genetic recombination and natural selection. It is represented by the equation  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>1</mn></math> , where  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math>  is the proportion of pure homozygous dominant individuals in the population,  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math>  is the proportion of pure homozygous recessive individuals in the population and 2pq is the proportion of heterozygous individuals in the population.
